issue.title: SubredditActivityAnalyzer is an infinite loop
issue.body:
Something in SubredditActivityAnalyzer in RedditAnalyzer causes the function to turn into an infinite loop. Not sure what it is I just know once that function is entered it never returns.

Replicate the same way as #6

issue.title: Documentation
issue.body: In the spirit of open source and allowing others to use our API, we need to document HTTP endpoints (all two of them lol). A readme is probably enough

issue.title: Comments
issue.body: need to comment our code to make it look good for judges

issue.title: SubredditKarmaAnalyzer crashes
issue.body:
SubredditKarmaAnalyzer function in RedditAnalyzer throws an ArgumentOutOfRangeException when run.

To replicate, run the program on google chrome, and when the website loads append "leaning/reddit/{any valid reddit username}" to the url

issue.title: SubredditKarmaAnalyzer crashes
issue.body:

issue.title: Train Naive Bayes classifier
issue.body: Need to connect our sample data to the Naive Bayes classifier. Ideally, issue #1 will be completed and we will load the sample data out of the file while constructing TextAnalyzer and train the classifier using the Bag of Words

issue.title: Save training data to disk
issue.body:
Need to save the training data to a file, like a csv or txt. That way we don't have to read the comments from the web APIs every time the program starts, but can just load the local file instead. This needs to be a relative path, so that it'll still work when uploaded to Azure

See: https://stackoverflow.com/a/31887149

issue.title: Collect more sample data
issue.body: More sample data is always good. Categorize more facebook/reddit accounts into Liberal and Conservative so we can pass them into the trainer
